title: Ticket #7634: Always generate the POOL password on startup and reconfig
description:
ToddT noticed that the POOL password auto-generation introduced in #7069 is subtly broken. Currently, the auto-generation only occurs if an authentication handshake occurs when IDTOKENS is listed as a possible authentication method. With more aggressive client-side authentication method filtering implemented over the last few releases, this occurs less frequently.

We can't quite figure out the archeology on this one but we think the idea was this behavior avoids creating a pool password file if IDTOKENS is never used. Given we have such a strong migration toward IDTOKENS these days, we think it's an acceptable overhead to always create this if missing on startup or reconfig. This would simplify the code paths and remove a bit of magic / complexity...
